This move looks solid, but it allows Morphy to begin seizing a commanding lead in development.
moves.5... Qb6: Preparing to smash McConnell's Pawn chain.
moves.6... Bd7: Clearing the B1 square for the Rook.
moves.7. a3: A horrible waste of time. 7 B-K2 followed by O-O and Q-side development was in order.
moves.8. b4: Another time-wasting Pawn move. Now Morphy blasts open a line for his heavy artillery.
moves.8... cxd4: If White recaptures with the Pawn...
moves.10. Bb2: Too little, too late. He should have started developing 3-4 moves ago.
moves.10... Nf5: Planting the Knight on a powerful outpost.
moves.11... Bxb4+: Exploiting White's lack of development. If White had played 7 B-K2 and 8 O-O Morphy could not now initiate this sacrificial attack.
moves.12... Nxb4: Driving the Q. If 13 Q-Q1, Morphy has 13 ...N-B7 ch 14 Any QxB regaining the piece and leaving Black two Pawns up and White with a hopeless positional disadvantage.
moves.13... Rc2: Now Morphy forces the Q back to Q1.
moves.14... Ne3: White's Q is trapped! McConnell resigns at once.
